newsitem.title: USA: US spot propane edges higher on coattails of crude.
newsitem.headline: US spot propane edges higher on coattails of crude.

text.p: U.S. spot liquids prices were mostly higher late Tuesday, traders said, with stronger crude more than offsetting concern about stronger import volumes.

Mont Belvieu propane edged 0.25 cent higher, with offers at 38.25 cents a gallon, traders said. Conway material was sold for 35.75 cents earlier in the day but climbed to 37.00 cents late afternoon -- a half cent higher than Tuesday.
"A few people came out selling this morning from fear of being too long, but higher crude propped things back up," one Conway propane broker said, noting crude settled $1.14-a-barrel higher.
Conway normal butane also gained a half cent to 40.0 cents, while Mont Belvieu normal edged 0.25 cent higher to 44.75 cents, traders said.
